chapter.para: As &productname; is constantly developed and improved, new versions get released. You are strongly advised to upgrade to a supported release. These upgrades may involve manual intervention.

sect1.title: Upgrading from &productname; 1
sect1.para: The following sections contain the necessary steps to upgrade from &productname; 1 to 2 or later.

sect2.title: Migrating Users
sect2.para: &productname; 2 comes with Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), which stores user information in OpenLDAP. Therefore, after upgrading from &productname; 1 to version 2 or higher, you have to migrate existing &dashboard; users to OpenLDAP users.
For more information about RBAC and user management, refer to .

step.screen: &prompt.root;docker exec -it $(docker ps | grep dashboard | awk '{print $1}') \ entrypoint.sh bundle exec rake velum:migrate_users

sect2.para: After running this command, existing user accounts will be available for logging into &dashboard; again.

sect2.title: Upgrading etcd
sect2.para: &productname; 2 comes with &kube; 1.7, which uses etcd version 3 as default storage backend. Therefore, after upgrading from &productname; 1 to version 2 or higher, you have to orchestrate the migration between etcd 2 and 3.
The orchestration will shutdown all etcd and kube-api services, perform the etcd migration steps, set the etcd_version = etcd3 pillar value, and restart etcd and kube-api.

important.title: Service Window Required
important.para: This migration can take a several minutes, during which etcd and kube-api services are unavailable. Please make sure to plan a service window.

step.screen: &prompt.root;docker exec -ti $(docker ps | grep salt-master | cut -d" " -f1) \ salt-run state.orchestrate orch.etcd-migrate

sect2.para: After the command successfully finished, all services will be available again.
